template.name: OS Linux
template.description:
Base Linux monitoring template.
Version: 1.0.4 (2018-06-11) URL: https://github.com/kloczek/zabbix-templates/tree/master/OS%20Linux
Notes: - compliant with EL7 and compatible

item.name: SYS::process::running
item.description: Number of processes in running state.

item.name: SYS::process::*
item.description: Total number of processes in any state.

item.name: SYS::ints
item.description: System interrupts per second.

item.name: SYS::load:$2
item.description: Avg1 system running queue length.

item.name: HW::CPU::cores
item.description: Number of CPU cores has been changed.

item.name: CPU::context switches
item.description:
All CPUs context switches per second.
lowered from 10 -> 5 second updates as characteristics observed are very different

item.name: CPU::$2::$3
item.description: The % time the CPU has spent doing nothing.

item.name: CPU::$2::$3
item.description: The % time the CPU has spent servicing interrupts.

item.name: CPU::$2::$3
item.description: The % time the CPU has been waiting for I/O to complete.

item.name: CPU::$2::$3
item.description: The % time the CPU has spent executing niced processes in user mode.

item.name: CPU::$2::$3
item.description: The % time the CPU has spent servicing softirqs.

item.name: CPU::$2::$3
item.description: The % time the CPU has spent running involuntary wait.

item.name: CPU::$2::$3
item.description: The % time the CPU has spent running the kernel and its processes.

item.name: CPU::$2::$3
item.description: The time the CPU has spent running users processes that are not niced.

item.name: SYS::hostname
item.description: System host name.

item.name: HW::CPU
item.description: All CPUs information.

item.name: HW::devices
item.description: List hardware devices used by the system.

item.name: NET::Connections aborted due to timeout
item.key: system.run["/bin/netstat -s|/bin/sed -n 's/\(.*\)connections aborted due to timeout/\1/ p'"]

item.name: SYS::rh-distribution
item.description: Content of /etc/redhat-release.

item.name: SYS::OS::version
item.description: OS info.

item.name: SYS::software
item.description: Full list of installed packages.

item.name: SYS::uname
item.description: The information as normally returned by 'uname -a'.

item.name: SYS::uptime
item.description: The OS uptime.

item.name: SYS::users sessions
item.description: Number of users tty sessions who are currently logged in.

item.name: CHK::Checksum::$1
item.description: Check sum of /etc/passwd.

item.name: CHK::checksum::$1
item.description: Check sum of /usr/bin/ssh binary.

item.name: CHK::Checksum::$1
item.description: Check sum of /usr/sbin/sshd binary.

item.name: MEM::$1
item.description: Available memory is defined as free+cached+buffers memory.

item.name: MEM::$1
item.description: The amount of physical RAM used for file buffers.

item.name: MEM::$1
item.description: The amount of physical RAM used as cache memory.

item.name: MEM::$1
item.description: The amount of physical RAM left unused by the system.

item.name: MEM::$1
item.description: Total amount of physical RAM.

item.name: MEM::$1
item.description: It is total-free RAM.

item_prototype.name: $1::in::bytes
item_prototype.description: Incoming traffic statistics on network interface in bytes.

item_prototype.name: $1::in::packets
item_prototype.description: Incoming traffic statistics on network interface in packets.

item_prototype.name: $1::out::bytes
item_prototype.description: Outgoing traffic statistics on network interface in bytes.

item_prototype.name: $1::out::packets
item_prototype.description: Outgoing traffic statistics on network interface in packets.

item_prototype.name: $1::total::dropped
item_prototype.description: Sum of incoming and outgoing traffic statistics on network interface - dropped packets.

item_prototype.name: $1::total::errors
item_prototype.description: Sum of incoming and outgoing traffic statistics on network interface. Number of errors.

trigger_prototype.name: NIC::{#IFNAME}: Errors seen (LV={ITEM.VALUE} TR={$WRN_ERR_SEC})
trigger_prototype.description: checks the number of errors per second is greater than one on any interface

trigger_prototype.name: NIC::{#IFNAME}: Errors seen (LV={ITEM.VALUE}})
trigger_prototype.description: checks the number of errors per second is greater than one on any interface

item.key: system.run["/bin/netstat -s|/bin/sed -n 's/\(.*\)connections aborted due to timeout/\1/ p'"]

discovery_rule.name: DSK:

item_prototype.name: {#DISK}::read::IOs
item_prototype.description: Number of read IO operation per second on block device in use.

item_prototype.name: {#DISK}::read::bytes
item_prototype.description: Number of read bytes per second on block device in use. Value is calculated by read number of sectors multiplied by 512.

item_prototype.name: {#DISK}::write::IOs
item_prototype.description: Number of write IO operation per second on block device in use.

item_prototype.name: {#DISK}::write::bytes
item_prototype.description: Number of written bytes per second on block device in use. Value is calculated by read number of sectors multiplied by 512.

trigger_prototype.name: VOL::{#FSNAME}::free {ITEM.VALUE}
trigger_prototype.description: FS volume free space is less than 15%.

trigger_prototype.name: VOL::{#FSNAME}::free {ITEM.VALUE}
trigger_prototype.description: FS volume free space is between 85% and 90%.

trigger_prototype.name: VOL::{#FSNAME}::free {ITEM.VALUE}
trigger_prototype.description: FS volume free space is less than 1%.

trigger_prototype.name: VOL::{#FSNAME}::free {ITEM.VALUE}
trigger_prototype.description: FS volume free space is less than 5%.

trigger_prototype.name: VOL::{#FSNAME}::free {ITEM.VALUE}
trigger_prototype.description: FS volume free space is between 1% and 5%.

trigger_prototype.name: VOL::{#FSNAME}::free {ITEM.VALUE}
trigger_prototype.description: FS volume free space is less than 10%.

trigger_prototype.name: VOL::{#FSNAME}::free {ITEM.VALUE}
trigger_prototype.description: FS volume free space is between 90% and 95%.

trigger_prototype.name: VOL::{#FSNAME}::inodes::free {ITEM.VALUE}
trigger_prototype.description: FS volume inodes free space is less than 15%.

trigger_prototype.name: VOL::{#FSNAME}::inodes::free {ITEM.VALUE}
trigger_prototype.description: FS volume inodes free space is between 15% and 10%.

trigger_prototype.name: VOL::{#FSNAME}::inodes::free {ITEM.VALUE}
trigger_prototype.description: FS volume inodes free space is less than 1%.

trigger_prototype.name: VOL::{#FSNAME}::inodes::free {ITEM.VALUE}
trigger_prototype.description: FS volume inodes free space is less than 5%.

trigger_prototype.name: VOL::{#FSNAME}::inodes::free {ITEM.VALUE}
trigger_prototype.description: FS volume inodes free space is between 5% and 1%.

trigger_prototype.name: VOL::{#FSNAME}::inodes::free {ITEM.VALUE}
trigger_prototype.description: FS volume inodes free space is less than 10%.

trigger_prototype.name: VOL::{#FSNAME}::inodes::free {ITEM.VALUE}
trigger_prototype.description: FS volume inodes free space is between 10% and 5%.

trigger.name: HW::devices list has been changed
trigger.description: Hardware devices list has been changed.

trigger.name: SYS::Host is down
trigger.description:
Instructions on how to handle this trigger if is active: * with daily autoscaling like PERF, PAT or DEV -> delete box * if it is PROD or STAGE box: ** remove all groups and assign box to "Terminated instances" group ** change Name to "term YYYY-MM-DD <orig_Name>" ** set host Monitored by proxy -> (no proxy) ** change state to "not monitored" * anything else -> investigate -> acknowledge and raise jira ticket if it is something unusual
s3-dump hosts delete

item.key: system.run["/bin/netstat -s|/bin/sed -n 's/\(.*\)connections aborted due to timeout/\1/ p'"]
